data.title: System.InvalidOperationException crash on Helipad sell
data.body:
As the title states if you sell the Helipad while helicopters are attempting to return to it (to rearm) you will experience a crash caused by a System.InvalidOperationException due to "Attempting to query the position of an invalid Target".

I assume the same will happen with planes and an Airfield but I am not sure.

data.title: AA gun polish
TD, Nod Apache ammo bug/exploit (updated, Orca has problems too)
data.body:
The Apache has 5 rounds in its magazine.
The Apacheâ€™s reload timer begins after firing the 1st rounds.
When the reload timer hits 0, all 5 rounds are refilled.

Usually, this results in the Apache firing 5 rounds in a row, and then after a brief downtime, it can fire another 5 rounds in a row.

However, if I fire the 1st round, wait for some time, and then fire the 4 remaining rounds, the reload will occur right after I use up the 4 remaining rounds, giving me 5 fresh rounds. This lets me fire 9 shots in a row.

I recommend either:
A) If the Apache fires its weapon when the reload timer is counting down, the reload will be interrupted, and the reload timer will be reset.
B) Make the Apache reload like the Orca: a little bit of ammo at a time, instead of an instant full reload at the end of a timer.

PS:

There also seems to be another bug, and I don't know if it is related: when trying to figure out exactly how long it takes for the apache to reload, it seems that the reload time is random. It always takes somewhere between 0 to 8 seconds to reload. This is weird, and reload time certainly shouldnâ€™t be random.

After the 1st reload, the time between the 1st reload and the 2nd reload is always approximately 8 seconds. Only this part is consistent. 

PSS:

I have confirmed that the Orca has the same reload time inconsistency problem. The Orca carries 6 missiles, and replenishes 2 missiles on every reload. 

The time between the 1st round fired and the 1st reload is random, and seems to be between 0 to 8 seconds. 

Sometimes, the reload is nearly instant, effectively allowing the Orca to fire 8 missiles in a row. Sometimes, after 6 missiles are fired, there is delay before the next 2 missiles can be fired.

After the 1st reload, the time between the 1st reload and the 2nd reload is again, always approximately 8 seconds. Only this part is consistent.

data.title: Investigate decreasing the default tick rate
data.body:
Decreasing the tick rate from 25 ticks per second to 10 would reduce the network and CPU requirements by 60%.  We would need to rebalance all the timings (easy with --upgrade-mod), and this may introduce noticeable quantization errors... but on the other hand, it might not.

This would be worth investigating as a potentially easy way to win a bunch of perf.

data.title: Formation selection for groups of units
data.body: When commanding lots of infantry it is generally better to have them spread out so that they don't get killed by a single V2 rocket or artillery shell. But right now this has to be done  manually which is impossible in a large game with many battles going on at the same time. This was not in the original Red Alert but it is a feature in modern RTS games and it would be a great addition I think.

data.title: Kamikaze as secondary attack for Yaks and Migs
data.body: When a Yak or Mig crashes into a building it inflicts more damage than it would using its weapons. It would be a nice feature to have a secondary attack for planes to crash themselves into targets. This would also require implementation of secondary attack option in general.

data.title: Removed demo.mix
data.body: I believe we harvested everything of interest from it. There is no reason to keep it in the source code repositories.

data.title: D2k balancing
data.body:
Ordos Raider trikes are way too good. They cost only 50 bucks more and have buffed speed, HP and Weapon damage. I nerfed the Raider trike by decreasing HP and weapon damage instead i increased the turning rate.

changelog so far:
Ordos Raider trike:
HP reduced from 110 to 100
Weapon changed from HMGo to HMG
Turning rate improved from 10 to 12

data.title: Submarines can launch torpedos through islands
data.body: In the map "bombardment islands", submarines were able to launch torpedos through one of those small islands that have oil derricks and sink a naval transporter. The torpedos traveled underneath the island but with water effects as they moved across land. I think I have the replay of the game if it would be helpful.

data.title: GPS does not update destroyed buildings if they are of known type.
data.body:
IE: You uncovered a enemy refinery so you can see in the shroud that it is a refinery, and it gets destroyed by a nuke which doesn't reveal the shroud it won't update.

If you did not see the building, it will just show the little house marker and it will remove it when the building is destroyed.

Am I explaining this correctly?

data.title: Webkit UI
data.body:
I saw this mentioned on IRC, and my understanding is that this has been discussed for some time. Personally I don't know the current GUI system well enough, to be objective in this discussion, but I'm making this issue to write down some webkit solutions.

http://awesomium.com - This has a .NET version, and is what the Wolfire guys use for UI in Overgrowth.
http://webkitdotnet.sourceforge.net/ - This is a thing, but I think it was designed for WinForms, not games.

The benefits of using a webkit powered UI, is so that people who know web coding can contribute without learning the current custom widgets system. Also it should be easier to make changes, without putting too much work into it, and therefore not get too hurt when it gets turned down.

data.title: Changes to Tiberium and Viceroids
data.body:
Tiberium Poisoning caused by walking on Tiberium with infantry is
nerfed.

W/O nerf: 16 seconds to kill Minigunner
W/ nerf: 31 seconds to kill Minigunner

Chance of viceroid spawning has been buffed.

W/O buff: with about 40-50 minigunners, only 1 will viceroid from just
standing on tiberium, other factors not counted.
W/ buff: with about 40-50 minigunners, 3 or more will viceroid from just
standing on tiberium, other factors not counted.

Viceroids have 100 less HP.

I don't need to explain this one.

Viceroids can no longer gain experience. They still give experience on
death though.

W/O buff/nerf/whateverthisis: Viceroids can gain experience and become
veterans, getting more health and doing more damage. Killing them gives
experience.
W/ buff/nerf/whatever: Viceroids cannot rank up and become veterans
anymore. Killing them gives experience.

data.title: Problem with OS X 10.9.2?
data.body:
Hey,

I upgraded to OS X 10.9.2 (from 10.9.1) yesterday, and since then I can't launch OpenRA. I get a black screen and the spinning beach ball of death and have to Force Quit the app. Nothing shows up in Console.app (besides the force quit), and the contents of `~/Library/Application Support/OpenRA/Logs` are as follows (I wiped my install and tried a fresh one):

-rw-r--r--  1 aaron  staff     0B 26 Feb 17:53 debug.log
-rw-r--r--  1 aaron  staff     0B 26 Feb 17:53 graphics.log
-rw-r--r--  1 aaron  staff     0B 26 Feb 17:53 perf.log
-rw-r--r--  1 aaron  staff     0B 26 Feb 17:53 server.log
-rw-r--r--  1 aaron  staff     0B 26 Feb 17:53 sound.log
-rw-r--r--  1 aaron  staff     0B 26 Feb 17:53 syncreport.log

Tried upgrading Mono to the latest version (3.2.7) but that had no noticeable impact. Thanks!

data.title: Out of range cursor
data.body: The out of range cursor is now shown when the actor is outside of firing range of the target. Adds #4545.

data.title: Add profile features to OpenRA
data.body:
The idea is to add an optional (important) log in feature to OpenRA that uses the profile from content.openra.net

Sanity check:
With this feature we could track statistics for players, like win/loss ratio, mod play time, faction play time and registered clan tags, etc.

Also automatic replay uploads (optional). This way we could only let the server save replays, and not have to rely on people remembering to upload the replays. The reason I mention this is because of the added features mentioned in #4716. If production queue data is sent to clients, it would be easy to cheat. But if the server is the only one that knows it, then less so.
We could also add a feature to see more about who you are playing against, if they have a profile. This could also be used in replays.

With this feature players can also have friends list, which would help them keep track of which of their friends are online, and we could add chat features.
We can also better keep track of who is online, and have a "LFG" kind of thing.

These are just the ideas I could come up with. Feedback would be appreciated.

data.title: Yaml to html
data.body:
Usage: OpenRA.Utility --stats MOD [output directory]

This adds a utility that converts the yaml files to html. This is intended to provide a website where people can see the current stats for units, etc. in release, and in bleed (to see what is coming).

A very simple example .css file is included in html/

I'm making this PR because the utility works, but also to get some feedback into features I should add and how I should do things.

data.title: OpenRA re-loads everything when you come back from game?
data.body:
Just noticed this tedious thing, if you watch replay for example, and quit, you have to wait for OpenRA front page to load again, and then you can click another replay (even if replay is like 30 secs long).

I have also disabled the "shellmap" (AKA background game "video"), but i don't think it makes it load any faster.

Could it be not re-loaded and just remained in the memory instead? Not sure why is it taking so many seconds anyway.

Those loading messages are annoyingly cryptic anyway. Is there any table to convert crypted loading messages into real messages?

data.title: RA maps revision
data.body:
Do you like those two balanced maps?

I only have intention to improve quality of play, while competing with lot of not precise maps.

I want also to underline, that my influence in OpenRA is strictly treated by me as a fan wanting to improve some things, to show ppl that earlier releases of CnC are actually the best (strategy/approach of gameplay).

I dont want to promote myself, so I have removed link from @author as well as I am releasing rights to those maps so that they can be modified by You for your needs.

http://content.open-ra.org/?p=detail&table=maps&id=1562
http://content.open-ra.org/?p=detail&table=maps&id=1560

*As far as I checked all the AI bots, there is no problem with game lag after destroying bridges, there is no other glitches too.

data.title: Attack units at bridges
data.body:
I was looking this issue in Issues, but really couldnt find one about obvious problem, which seemed to be known; but for sure, I have created ticket about that.

You cant attack units at both sides of bridge (entrance/exit).

Its probably fault of function that overrides unit targetting at the spot where bridge is undestroyable.

data.title: Chronosphere bug: Tanks do not teleport back.
data.body:
Mammoth tanks that are teleported, stay where they are indefinately and do not teleport back after 20 seconds. I have the replay of the game where this happened if that helps.

data.title: Unit production stalls when structure's rally point is occupied
data.body:
This seems to be the case for all unit producing structures. When a unit pops out of it and cannot path to the rally point (because the rally point is blocked by another unit) the unit will stop moving where it is and prevent further production.

I'd suggest the unit attempt to move as close to the rally point as possible instead, so as to not inhibit unit production.

<bountysource-plugin>

---

Want to back this issue? **[Place a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/1428091-unit-production-stalls-when-structure-s-rally-point-is-occupied?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: TD : move Back button to the left
data.body:
For UI consistency, the BACK button (in the TD mod) should always be at the same location. 
- SinglePlayer's Leave button is on the right, Settings & Extras Back buttons are on the right
- Multiplayer & Mods' Back button are on the left

pchote suggested that the Back button should be on the left everywhere in TD menu.

data.title: Tiberium Dawn Specific: AI sends it's infantry through tiberium which kills them
data.body:
Basically, if one of the paths to get to you goes through tiberium, the AI will send it's infantry and tanks through it to get at you, completely ignoring the fact tiberium kills infantry, resulting in the death of most of the AI's troops.

I'm guessing this is because the AI for crossing ore is the same as crossing ore in RA, where it doesn't hurt you.
